rounds.event: Syrian civil war: The Movement for a Democratic Society (TEV-DEM) is established with the stated goal of re-organizing Syria along the lines of democratic confederalism.

Nebraska becomes the 36th state to approve the Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution. With the necessary three-quarters of the states approving the amendment, Prohibition is constitutionally mandated in the United States one year later.
births: Jerome Horwitz, American chemist and academic
deaths: Francisco de Paula Rodrigues Alves, Brazilian lawyer and politician, fifth President of Brazil

rounds.event: The first impeachment of Donald Trump formally moves into its trial phase in the United States Senate.
